member.name: T:Opc.Ua.Configuration.IApplicationConfigurationBuilderSecurity
member.summary: Add the security configuration (mandatory).

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.Configuration.IApplicationConfigurationBuilderSecurity.AddSecurityConfiguration(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Add the security configuration.
member.remarks: The pki root path default to the certificate store location as defined in A defaults to the corresponding default store location.
member.param: Application certificate subject name as distinguished name. A DC=localhost entry is converted to the hostname. The common name CN= is mandatory.
The path to the pki root. By default all cert stores use the pki root.
The path to the app cert store, if different than the pki root.
The path to the rejected certificate store.

member.name: T:Opc.Ua.Configuration.IApplicationConfigurationBuilderSecurityOptions
member.summary: Add security options to the configuration.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.Configuration.IApplicationConfigurationBuilderSecurityOptions.SetAutoAcceptUntrustedCertificates(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether an unknown application certificate should be accepted once all other security checks passed.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.Configuration.IApplicationConfigurationBuilderSecurityOptions.SetAddAppCertToTrustedStore(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether a newly created application certificate should be added to the trusted store. This function is only useful if multiple UA applications share the same trusted store.
member.param: to add the cert to the trusted store.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.Configuration.IApplicationConfigurationBuilderSecurityOptions.SetRejectSHA1SignedCertificates(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reject SHA1 signed certificates.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.Configuration.IApplicationConfigurationBuilderSecurityOptions.SetRejectUnknownRevocationStatus(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reject chain validation with CA certs with unknown revocation status, e.g. when the CRL is not available or the OCSP provider is offline.
member.param: to accept CA certs with unknown revocation status.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.Configuration.IApplicationConfigurationBuilderSecurityOptions.SetSuppressNonceValidationErrors(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether to suppress errors which are caused by clients and servers which provide zero nonce values or nonce with insufficient entropy. Suppressing this error is a security risk and may allow an attacker to decrypt user tokens. Only use if interoperability issues with legacy servers or clients leave no other choice to operate.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.Configuration.IApplicationConfigurationBuilderSecurityOptions.SetSendCertificateChain(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether a certificate chain should be sent with the application certificate. Only used if the application certificate is CA signed.
member.param: to send the certificate chain with the application certificate.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.Configuration.IApplicationConfigurationBuilderSecurityOptions.SetMinimumCertificateKeySize(System.UInt16)
member.summary: The minimum RSA key size to accept. By default the key size is set to .
member.param: The minimum RSA key size to accept.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.Configuration.IApplicationConfigurationBuilderSecurityOptions.AddCertificatePasswordProvider(Opc.Ua.ICertificatePasswordProvider)
member.summary: Add a certificate password provider.
member.param: The certificate password provider to use.
